message.content:
cs.IT, cs.COMM, cs.SI, cs.MM, cs.DS

Reasoning: The paper deals with source-channel coding and communication systems, which are typically studied in the Information Theory (cs.IT) and Communications (cs.COMM) sub-categories. The use of channel state information and alternate capacity and distortion metrics suggests a focus on Signal Processing (cs.SI) and Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-categories. Additionally, the mention of ergodic sources and channels suggests a possible connection to Dynamical Systems (cs.DS) sub-category.
